subject: Football
Colleges and Universities
lead_paragraph: The National Football Foundation and Hall of Fame, which chose 13 players and 2 coaches from major colleges last week, added 4 players and 2 coaches from smaller colleges. The players were defensive end John Randle of Texas A&M-Kingsville (1988-89), quarterback Jim Ballard of Mount Union (1991-93), linebacker Ronald McKinnon of North Alabama (1992-95) and halfback Brad Rowland of McMurry (1947-50). The coaches were W. C. Gorden of Jackson State (1976-91) and Doug Porter of Mississippi Valley State (1961-65), Howard (1974-78) and Fort Valley State (1979-96).
